workflow.name: Social media auto-posting to Instagram, Facebook & LinkedIn from Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## üìå Workflow Overview

This workflow enables **multi-platform social media posting** using **Google Sheets as the control center**.

Whenever a new row is added to the sheet, the workflow automatically posts the content to **Instagram, Facebook, and/or LinkedIn** based on platform flags, then updates the post status to prevent duplicates.

### Supported Platforms
- Instagram (Business)
- Facebook Pages
- LinkedIn Pages

---

## üß† Key Concept

*Google Sheets acts as a lightweight CMS and automation trigger.*

Each row represents **one post**, and simple TRUE/FALSE columns decide where that post should be published.

---

## üìÑ Required Google Sheets Columns

The content sheet must include the following columns:

- **Content** ‚Äì Text to publish  
- **Instagram** ‚Äì TRUE / FALSE  
- **Facebook** ‚Äì TRUE / FALSE  
- **LinkedIn** ‚Äì TRUE / FALSE  
- **Status** ‚Äì Updated after posting  
- **Row Number** ‚Äì Used for precise updates  

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How This Workflow Works

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Trigger: New Content Added
- The workflow starts when a **new row is added** to Google Sheets.
- This allows near real-time publishing without manual execution.

---

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Configuration Setup
- Platform-specific values like:
  - Instagram Business Account ID
  - Facebook Page ID  
- Are defined once in a **configuration node** for easy reuse and maintenance.

---

### 3Ô∏è‚É£ Platform Routing Logic
- IF nodes check each platform column:
  - Instagram = TRUE ‚Üí post to Instagram
  - Facebook = TRUE ‚Üí post to Facebook
  - LinkedIn = TRUE ‚Üí post to LinkedIn
- One row can trigger posting to **multiple platforms**.

---

### 4Ô∏è‚É£ Platform Posting
- Posts are published using:
  - Facebook Graph API (Instagram + Facebook)
  - LinkedIn API (LinkedIn Pages)
- The **Content** column is used directly as the post body.

---

### 5Ô∏è‚É£ Status Update (Per Platform)
- After posting:
  - The workflow updates the same row using **Row Number**
  - Marks the post as completed for that platform
- This prevents duplicate or accidental re-posts.

---

## üîÑ Current Capabilities

- Multi-platform posting from one sheet  
- Platform-specific routing logic  
- Real-time execution on new content  
- Safe status updates using row matching  

---

## üöÄ Designed for Easy Expansion

This workflow is intentionally modular and can be extended with:

- Scheduled posting (date/time columns)
- Image & media handling
- AI-generated captions
- Hashtag optimization
- Engagement analytics
- Retry & error handling logic

---

## ‚úÖ Best Practices

- Use **TRUE / FALSE** consistently in platform columns  
- Keep Google Sheets as the single source of truth  
- Add validation or approval columns if used by teams  

---

## üì¶ Ideal Use Cases

- Social media managers  
- Marketing teams  
- Founders & creators  
- Agencies handling multiple platforms  

---

*This workflow provides a scalable foundation for social media automation while remaining simple, transparent, and easy to maintain.*

workflow.name: 4 Multi-Platform Social Media Content Distribution with Google Sheets Integration

parameters.content:
## Trigger & Configuration

Detects new rows added to Google Sheets and sets required configuration values such as platform IDs before routing the post through the workflow.

## Platform Routing














Checks platform flags from the sheet (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn) and routes the post only to the platforms marked as TRUE.

## How it works

This workflow automatically publishes social media posts using Google Sheets as a lightweight content calendar.  
Each new row added to the sheet represents one post. Platform-specific flags (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn) determine where the content should be published.

When a new row is detected, the workflow reads the post content, checks which platforms are enabled, and publishes the post to the selected platforms. After each successful post, the workflow updates the same row in Google Sheets with a status so you can track what has already been published.

This design keeps content creation simple (Google Sheets) while automation handles distribution and status tracking. No manual posting is required once the row is added.

## Setup steps

1. Create a Google Sheet with columns:  
   **Content**, **Instagram**, **Facebook**, **LinkedIn**, **Status**
2. Connect your Google Sheets account in n8n.
3. Add your Instagram Business Account ID and Facebook Page ID in the **Workflow Configuration** node.
4. Connect Facebook Graph API and LinkedIn credentials.
5. Set platform columns to `TRUE` or `FALSE` for each post.
6. Add a new row to publish automatically.

## Publish Posts

Publishes the content text to the selected social media platforms using their respective APIs.

## Update Sheet Status

Updates the original Google Sheets row after posting, allowing you to track which platforms were successfully published.

user.name: Dinakar Selvakumar
user.bio: Turning real business problems into clean n8n automations. I design reliable templates for social media, lead generation, AI agents, and internal workflows, with a strong focus on simplicity, security, and great user experience.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
